MSS.239Fales Library and Special CollectionsFales Library and Special CollectionsElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South3rd FloorNew York, NY 10012Phone: (212) 998-2596fales.library@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2017-07-06T20:04:08
Fales Library and Special Collections
The Sabbateni Collection of Renaissance Music Manuscripts MSS.239
13 Volumes
circa 1600 The Sabbateni collection contains printed and manuscript music parts bound into 13 volumes, for the use of a four-part chorus in Prague, circa 1603-1604.
Provenance
The volumes were purchased in 1999.
Scope and Content
The Sabbateni collection contains printed and manuscript music parts bound into 13 volumes, for the use of a four-part chorus in Prague, circa 1603-1604.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Sabbateni Collection of Renaissance Manuscripts; MSS 239; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Music |y 17th century Music |v Manuscripts.
Bound VolumesSabbateni 1 (formerly A.1)circa 1600
Scope and Content
Six manuscripts bound together, with a total of 115 works
Four part-books: Discantus, Tenor, Altus, Sextus, of a set of at least sixAltus1Discantus2Tenor3Sextus4Sabbateni 2 (formerly A.2)circa 1600
Scope and Content
A single manuscript, with 38 works
Two partbooks, Discantus and Quintus, from a set of fiveDiscantus5Quintus6Sabbateni 3 (formerly A.3)circa 1600
Scope and Content
Two manuscripts, bound together with a total of 109 works
Two part-books, Discantus and Bassus, from a set of at least sixDiscantus7Bassus8Sabbateni 4 (formerly A.4)circa 1600
Scope and Content
Three manuscripts bound together, with a total of 91 works
One part-book, Bassus, from a set, probably of sixBassus9Sabbateni 5 (formerly B.1)circa 1600
Scope and Content
Five editions, bound together
(1): Thesaurus Musicus [I] (Nürnberg: Montanus & Neuber, 1564) RISM 15641: T; T2; B2
(2): Thesauri Musici II (Nürnberg: Montanus & Neuber, 1564) RISM 15642: T; 5; 7
(3): Thesauri Musici III (Nürnberg: Montanus & Neuber, 1564) RISM 15643: T; Vag
(4): Thesauri Musici IV (Nürnberg: Montanus & Neuber, 1564) RISM 15644: T; Vag
(5): Thesauri Musici V (Nürnberg: Montanus & Neuber, 1564) RISM 15645: T
Bassus Secundus10Tenor11Tenor Secundus12Sabbateni 6 (formerly B.2)circa 1600
Scope and Content
Nine editions, bound together
(1): Lassus: Cantiones Sacrae à6 (München: Heinrich, 1601) RISM 16013
(2): Reiner: LIber Mottetarum à6,8 (München: Heinrich, 1600) RISM R1086
(3): Agricola, J.: Motetae novae à4-8 (Nürnberg: Agricola, 1601) RISM A432

(5): Franck, M.: I Sacrarum Melodiarum à4-8 (Augsburg: Schönigk, 1601) RISM F1641
(6): Hassler, J.: Madrigali à6 (Nürnberg: Kaufmann, 1600) RISM H2345
(7): Aichinger: Liber Sacrarum Cantionum à5-8 (Nürnberg: Kauffmann, 1597) RISM A519
(8): Hausmann: Manipulus Sacrarum Cantionum à5-6 (Nürnberg: Kauffmann, 1602) RISM H2377
(9): Aichinger: Odaria Lectissima à3-4 (Augsburg: Willer (Praetorius), 1601) RISM A5244
Three part-books, Camtus, Altus and Tenor, from a set of at least six, probably eightCantus13Altus14Tenor15Sabbateni 7 (formerly B.3)circa 1600

(4): manuscript, with 12 works.
Four part-books: Cantus,Bassus, Quintus and Septimus, from a set probably of eightCantus16Bassus17Quintus18Septimus19Sabbateni 8 (formerly B.4)circa 1600

Scope and Content
The four editions of the works of Jacobus Gallus Handl

(2): Handl: II Operis Musici (Prag: Nigrin, 1587) RISM H1981
(3): Handl: III Operis Musici (Prag: Nigrin, 1587) RISM H1982
(4): Handl: IV Operis Musici (Prag: Nigrin, 1590) RISM H1985
Two part-books, Cantus and Tenor, from a set of sixCantus25Tenor26Sabbateni 11(formerly B.7)circa 1600
Scope and Content
Five editions with a manuscript appendix, bound together
(1): Sacrae Symphoniae à4-16, ed. K. Hassler (Nürnberg: Kauffmann, 1601) RISM 16012
(2): Sacrarum Symphoniarum Continuatio à4-12 (Nürnberg: Kauffmann, 1600) RISM 16002

(5): Gumpelzhaimer: I Sacrorum Cantionum à8 (Augsburg: Schönigk, 1601) RISM G5139
(6): Manuscript appendix of one work.
